newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian business welcomes interest rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Australian business welcomes interest rate cut.

text.p: The Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry welcomed on Friday the latest interest rate cut, saying it was long overdue.

"With yesterday's release of the private sector wage growth figures, there was no further reason for the Reserve Bank of Australia to delay its cut," chief executive Mark Paterson said in a statement.

He said the rate cut would make an important difference to business prospects and employment. "This downwards adjustment today will have changed sentiment in the business community and will have provided a needed impetus to the economy," he said.
The Reserve Bank announced earlier on Friday it had cut interest rates by 0.5 percentage points to 5.5 percent.
It was the fourth rate cut in less than a year and takes the total reduction over that time to two percentage points.
